usefulItems: loaf tin (30 cm x 12 cm x 10 cm), baking paper, wire rack, oven
title: Spelt Bread

preparations.content: Place 250 g spelt grains in mixing bowl and grind <b>1 min/speed 10<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place remaining 450 g spelt grains in mixing bowl and grind coarsely <b>1 min/speed 10<b>.
Add water, reserved ground spelt grains, fresh yeast, sugar, sunflower seeds, allspice, coriander and salt and knead <b>5 min/<b>.
Preheat oven to 250°C and line a loaf tin (30 cm x 12 cm x 10 cm) with baking paper or grease it lightly.
Place dough in prepared tin and leave to rest in a warm place for 15 minutes.
Bake for 20 minutes (250°C) then reduce oven temperature to 200°C and bake for a further 30 minutes. Remove loaf from tin and leave to cool completely on a wire rack before serving in slices.

hintsAndTricks: The recipe works well with only <b>15 minutes<b> rising in <b>step 5.<b> If you wish, you can decrease the yeast amount and increase the rising time.
If the crust browns too quickly, cover bread with aluminium foil towards the end of the baking time.
The bread is ready when it sounds hollow if you tap its underside.
